channel.title: Linux
channel.description: i am planning on downloading linux next time i reformat my computer. i was just wondering the risks of what will happen if i screw up, what the point of it, best version, and can i still access the windows part? kthxbye

item.title: Linux
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

Hiaburi:

Well if you format then no you can’t access the windows anymore lol, but if you still want to have windows, just format, install windows, but only set the drive partition to half your hard drive, then install and all. Then boot off a live cd, I’ve never used kubuntu but it should still be just as easy. so then you install the linux OS onto the other half of your hard drive and your done.

my computer has a built-in backup so i reformat once a month, it takes 30 minutes to do it.

Go with ubuntu for your starter, in my opinion it is a horrible system though and most people try that, don't like it and judge all other linux distros on that. But i suppose ubuntu is good to start off.
whatever i'll try but i need to free shit so i can get started im a download whore.

Read full topic

Thing is if you’ve never used a linux distro before, its nothing like windows, it may take some time for you to get used to it all, don’t just give up on it.

item.title: Linux
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

I beg to differ on the point that “Linux” is faster than Windows. But anyway…

For starters, Linux isn’t a an operating system, it’s a company. There’s several different Linux distros (operating systems). Like Microsoft is a company and there’s several different versions of Windows.

Two of the most common ones for people just starting are Ubuntu and Kubuntu. Feel free to look those up yourself (and other distros). I’d suggest you dual boot with Windows just in case you think it sucks and want to go back to what you know. There’s a tutorial on how to dual boot in the tutorials section here. There’s almost a Linux section here that you can go to and ask any questions that you have about whatever distro you use.

Read full topic
